discussion_comments.comment_body:
PowerShell script execution path is incorrect. In GitHub Actions, PowerShell scripts should be called with explicit path (./build.ps1) or dot-sourcing (. .\build.ps1) to ensure the runner can locate and execute the script. The current syntax may fail to find the script in the working directory.

📚 [Relevant Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/use-cases-and-examples/building-and-testing/building-and-testing-powershell)

           key: ${{ runner.os }}-node-${{ hashFiles('gui/package-lock.json') }}

+      - name: Build packages (Unix)

discussion_comments.comment_body:
The workflow attempts to execute build.sh script without first setting execute permissions. On Unix systems, this will fail with 'permission denied'. Add a step before this to run 'chmod +x build.sh' to grant execute permissions to the script.

📚 [Relevant Docs](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#jobsjob_idstepsrun)

<!-- metadata:{"confidence":8,"steps":[{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"openai-adapters-tests:\" -n .github/workflows/pr_checks.yaml"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"^  openai-adapters-tests:\" .github/workflows/pr_checks.yaml"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"openai-adapters-tests:\" -n .github/workflows/pr_checks.yaml"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]}]} -->
Job consumes repository secrets unconditionally. For PRs opened from forks, these secrets are not provided by GitHub, causing the tests to fail and blocking external contributors. Add a guard (e.g. IGNORE_API_KEY_TESTS flag or an `if:` condition) similar to the `core-tests` job.

<details>
<summary>Prompt for AI agents</summary>

```
Address the following comment on .github/workflows/pr_checks.yaml at line 601:

<comment>Job consumes repository secrets unconditionally. For PRs opened from forks, these secrets are not provided by GitHub, causing the tests to fail and blocking external contributors. Add a guard (e.g. IGNORE_API_KEY_TESTS flag or an `if:` condition) similar to the `core-tests` job.</comment>
```
